titleStmt.title: An entry from the Journals of Hensley Henson

sourceDesc.bibl: Edited from the manuscripts in the custody of Durham Cathedral Library.

p.hi: I dined in Hatfield Hall with Colonel Grimshaw and his officers. Rogerson was there: he said that no further news had been received from his son, who is a prisoner in Germany. They expressed themselves in very appreciative terms with respect to the Parade Services.
